description: TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION RATIFYING A TREATY BETWEEN THE U. S. AND THE MENOMINEE INDIANS MADE ON 3/30/1817 AT ST. LOUIS.
TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION RATIFYING A TREATY BETWEEN THE U. S. AND THE OTTOES INDIANS MADE ON 6/24/1817 AT ST. LOUIS.
TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION RATIFYING A TREATY BETWEEN THE U. S. AND THE PONCARAR INDIANS, MADE ON 6/25/1817 AT ST. LOUIS.
TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION RATIFYING A TREATY BETWEEN THE U. S. AND THE CHEROKEE INDIANS, MADE ON 7/8/1817.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION  AMENDING THE LAWS OF THE U. S. ON THE SUBJECT OF AFRICAN SLAVE TRADE, BY ELIMINATING THAT PART OF RESOLUTION THAT SEEKS TO PREVENT CITIZENS OF THE U. S. FROM CARRYING ON SLAVE TRADE UNDER FOREIGN FLAGS.

TO AMEND THE 6TH ARTICLE OF TREATY WITH THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELAWARE, SHAWANESE, POTAWATAMIE, OTTAWAS, AND CHIPPEWAY TRIBES OF INDIANS, WHICH PROVIDES FOR CERTAIN GRANTS OF LAND TO THE INDIANS; BY ADDING: "THAT IN ADDITION TO SAID GRANTS OF LAND, THERE HALL BE RESERVED FOR THE USE OF SAID TRIBE (DELAWARES), A TRACT OF 112 SQUARE MILES, WHICH SHALL BE LAID OFF, ADJOINING TO, AND ON THREE SIDES OF, THE AFORESAID TRACT OF TWELVE SQUARE MILES, IN EQUAL QUANTITIES ON EACH SIDE, TO HAVE THE BOUNDARY LINE ADJO...

TO AMEND THE 6TH ARTICLE OF TREATY WITH THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELAWARE, SHAWANESE, POTOWATAMIE, OTTAWAS, AND CHIPPEWAY TRIBES OF INDIANS, BY ADDING: "AND THERE SHALL BE RESERVED FROM SALE BY THE UNITED STATES, AFTER A SURVEY OF LANDS SHALL HAVE BEEN MADE,EVERY QUARTER SECTION AND FRACTION OF A SECTION LYING WEST OF AND ADJOINING THE SANDUSKY RIVER, OPPOSITE THE AFORESAID TRACT PROVIDED TO BE GRANTED TO THE CHIEFS FOR THE SENECA TRIBE, WHERE SUCH QUARTER SECTION OR FRACTION IS NOW INHABITED AND OCCUPIED FO...

TO PASS A RESOLUTION TO RATIFY THE 7TH ARTICLE OF A TREATY WITH THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELAWARE, SHAWANESE, POTAWATAMIE, OTTAWAS, AND CHIPPEWAY TRIBES OF INDIANS, SAID ARTICLE HAS TO DO WITH DISPOSAL AND USE OF LANDS CEDED TO THE INDIANS BY THEIR CHIEFS ORTHEIR SUCCESSORS.

TO AMEND THE 7TH SECTION OF THE TREATY WITH THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELEWARE, SHAWANESE, POTAWATAMIE, OTTAWAS AND CHIPPEWAY TRIBES OF INDIANS, BY SUBSTITUTING "THAT THE CHIEFS OR HIS SUCCESSORS MAY CONVEY OR REFUSE TO CONVEY TO PERSONS OR HIS HEIRS MENTIONE IN THE SECHEDULE, THE QUANTITY OF LAND THEREBY SECURED TO HIM AND SUCH LAND CON- VEYED OR GRANTED PURSUANT TO THE TREATY, SHALL NOT BE SOLD, CONVEYED OR LEASED TO ANY PERSON OTHER THAN AN INDIAN UNLESS AUTHORIZED BY AN AGREEMENT BETWEEN HIS TRIBE, IN PUB...
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING TWO ADDITIONAL ARTICLES RELA- TIVE TO THE PEACE TREATY WITH THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELAWARE, SHAWANESE, POTAWATAMIE, OTTAWA AND CHIPPEWAY TRIBES OF INDIANS.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION PERMITTING A MEMBER OF THE SENATE TO RELATE IN A COURT OF JUSTICE OR ELSEWHERE, ANY PROCEEDINGS IN THE SENATE APRIL 1816, UPON PRESIDENT'S NOMINATION OF ALEXANDER SCOTT OF MARYLAND TO OFFICE OF "COMMISSIONER UNDER THE ACT PROVIDING FR THE PAYMENT OF PROPERTY LOST, CAPTURED OR DESTROYED BY THE ENEMY AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES".

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION REIMBURSING J. PETERS AND S. POND FOR THE FORFIETURE OF A CERTAIN BRIGAND CARGO FOR THE VIOLA- TION OF THE REVENUE LAWS, SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT AFTER THE WORD "THAT", AND INSERT: "A BILL BE REPORTED AUTHORIZING THE PETITIONES TO HAVE THE BENEFIT OF A HEARING BEFORE THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY IN THE SAME MANNER AS IF A CONDEM- NATION OF THEIR PROPERTY HAD NOT OCCURRED, SO FAR AS RE- SPECTS THE MOIETY OF THE FORFIETURE VESTED IN THE U

TO RECOMMIT THE TREATY WITH THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELAWARE, SHAWANESE, POTAWATAMIE, OTTAWAS AND CHIPPEWAY TRIBES OF INDIANS TOGETHER WITH RESOLUTION FOR ITS RATIFICATION, TO THE COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC LANDS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO IMPART SAME BACK, WITHOUT AMENMENTS.

TO AMEND THE TREATY WITH THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELAWARE, SHANANESE, POTAWATAMIE, OTTAWAS AND CHIPPEWAY TRIBES OF INDIANS; BY ADDING TO THE SUBSTITUTE FOR THE 7TH ARTICLE WHICH FORBIDS THE TRANSFER OF LAND GRANTED UNDER THIS TREATY TO ANYBODY OTHER THAN ANINDIAN, THE PROVISION THAT ANY SUCH TRANSFER SHALL BE INVALID UNLESS AGREED TO BY THE INDIAN TRIBE INVOLVED AND AN AGENT OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO RETAIN IN THE 7TH ARTICLE OF TREATY WITH THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELAWARE, SHAWANESE, POTAWATAMIE, OTTAWAS AND CHIPPEWAY TRIBES OF INDIANS, THE CLAUSE WHICH WOULD MAKE POSSIBLE THE TRANSFER OF LANDS TO OTHER THAN INDIANS, IF AGREED TO BY THE TRIBE INTERETED AND AN AGENT OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE TREATY WITH THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELAWARE, SHAWANESE, POTAWATAMIE, OTTAWAS, AND CHIPPEWA TRIBES OF INDIANS; AND THAT THE PRESIDENT NEGOTIATE FURTHER WITH SAID TRIBES.

TO RECEIVE AND ENTER IN THE JOURNAL THE RESOLUTIONS FROM THE LEGISLATURE OF TENNESSE  PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION PROVIDING THAT NO LAW VARYING THE COMPENSATIONS OF THE MEMBERS OF THE CONGRESS SHALL TAKE EFFECT, UNTIL THE EXPIRATION OF THETERM OF OFFICE OF THE MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES OF THAT CONGRESS WHICH PASSED THE LAW.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF ARCHIBALD HAMILTON AS ASSISTANT DEPUTY QUARTERMASTER GENERAL.
TO POSTPONE TO THE 1ST MONDAY IN JULY, CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 8 (3 STAT. L. 410, APP. 3/18/1818), A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR CERTAIN SURVIVING SOLDIERS OF THE REVOLUTIONARY ARMY.

TO AMEND H. R. 8 (3 STAT. L. 410, APP. 3/18/1818), A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR CERTAIN SURVIVING OFFICERS AND SOLDIERS OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR; SAID AMENDMENT DIRECTS THAT THE PEN- SIONS ALLOWED SHALL NOT BE PAID TO OFFICERS, PRIVATES, OR MUSICIANS, WHOSE "ESATE" AT THE TIME OF APPLICATION SHALL AMOUNT TO A SPECIFIED AMOUNT.

TO REFER H. R. 63 (6 STAT. L. 200, APP. 3/9/1818), A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF MAJOR GENERAL ARTHUR ST. CLAIR, TO THE COMMITTEE ON PENSIONS WITH INSTRUCTIOSN TO REDUCE THE PEN- SION ALLOWED A LIEUTENANT COLONEL, SO AS NOT TO EXCEED THAT ALLOWED BY LAW.
TO PASS H. R. 63 (6 STAT. L. 200, APP. 3/9/1818), A BILL TO PROVIDE A PENSION FOR MAJOR GENERAL ARTHUR ST. CLAIR.

TO AMEND H. R. 8 (3 STAT. 410, APP. 3/18/1818), A BILL PRO- VIDING FOR SURVIVING OFFICERS AND SOLDIERS OF THE REVOLU- TIONARY ARMY, SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT OF SECTION 1, THE PROVISION REQUIRING A MINIMUM OF 2 YEARS OF SERVICE.

TO AMEND H. R. 8, BY INSERTING IN SECTION 1, LINE 12 IN PLACE OF "THEREOF FOR THE TERM OF THREE YEARS" THE FOLLOWING "OR DURING THE WHOLE TERM FOR WHICH THEY WERE ENGAGED, UN- LESS THEY WERE DISCHARGED, OR LEFT THE SERVICE THROUGH SOME DERANGEMENT OF THEARMY, OR IN CONSEQUENCE OF THEIR DISABI- LITY RESIGNED THEIR COMMISSION, OR WERE IN CAPTIVITY OR ON PAROLE UNTIL THE CLOSE OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR".
TO AMEND H. R. 8, BY INSERTING IN SECTION 1, A PROVISION MAKING NINE MONTHS THE MINIMUM LENGTH OF SERVICE FOR PENSION ELIGIBILITY.

TO RECOMMIT H. R. 8, TO THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO AMEND SAME TO CONFORM TO RULES AND REGULATIONS TO BE OBSERVED IN SUBSTANTIATING A PENSION CLAIM AS PRESCRIBED IN THE ACT OF 4/10/1806.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 8, IN SECTION 1, BY MAKING THE PROVISO READ, "NO PERSON SHALL BE ENTITLED TO THE PRO- VISIONS OF THE ACT, UNTIL HE HAS RELINQUISHED HIS CLAIM TO EVERY PENSION HERETOFORE ALLOWED HIM BY THE LAWS OF THE U. S. OR ANY INDIVIDUL STATE".

TO AMEND H. R. 8, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION THAT NO PER- SON SHALL BE ENTITLED TO THE BENEFIT OF THE ACT UNTIL HE SHALL HAVE RELINQUISHED HIS RIGHT TO EVERY PENSION HERETO- FORE ALLOWED HIM BY ANY FEDERAL OR STATE LAW.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H. R. 8.

TO AMEND THE BILL REGARDING THE TRANSPORTATION OF PERSONS OF COLOR FOR SALE, OR TO BE HELD TO LABOR, BY ELIMINATING THE 6TH SECTION WHICH PROVIDES FOR A FINE OF $1,000 FOR EACH SLAVE TRANSPORTED BY LAND FROM ONE STATE TO ANOTHER FOR THE PURPOSE OF SALE.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE RESOLUTION, PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THAT PART OF THE CONSTITUTION RE- LATING TO THE ELECTION OF REPRESENTATIVE IN CONGRESS AND THE APPOINTMENT OF PRESIDENTIAL ELECTORS.
TO DISCHARGE THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS FROM FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE MEMORIAL FROM CHARLES BIDDLE AND OTHERS REQUESTING A PENSION.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE FROM H. R. 8, THE CLAUSE WHICH STIPULATES THAT NO PERSON SHALL RECEIVE A PEN- SION UNDER THIS ACT; UNLESS HE RELINQUISHES HIS RIGHT TO ANY PENSION HE MAY BE ENTITLED TO FROM ANY STATE.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THAT PART OF THE CONSTITUTION RELATING TO THE ELECTION OF REPRESENTATIVES TO CONGRESS, AND THE APPOINTMENT OF PRESIDENTIAL ELECTORS.
TO POSTPONE TO 1ST MONDAY IN JULY, CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 18 A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE RETURN OF SLAVES WHO ESCAPE FROM ONE STATE OR TERRITORY TO ANOTHER.

TO AMEND H. R. 18, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE RETURN OF SLAVES ESCAPING FROM ONE STATE OR TERRITORY TO ANOTHER, SAID AMEND- MENT TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION THAT A SLAVE ESCAPING TO ANOTHER STATE BE ARRESTED AND RETURNED TO OWNER, THE REASON- ABLE EXPENSES O BE PAID BY THE AGENT OF THE EXECUTIVE RE- QUESTING SUCH ACTION.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 18, A BILL PROVIDING FOR DEL- IVERY OF PERSONS HELD TO LABOR OR SERVICE IN ANY OF THE STATES OR TERRITORIES WHO SHALL ESCAPE INTO ANY OTHER STATE OR TERRITORY, BY PROVIDING THAT TO SECURE THE RETURN OF AN ESCAPED SLAVE, A CRTIFICATE BE REQUIRED STATING THAT SAID SLAVE OWED SERVICE TO THE PERSON CLAIMING HIM.
TO PASS H. R. 18, AS AMENDED, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE RE- TURN OF SLAVES ESCAPING FROM ONE STATE OR TERRITORY TO ANOTHER.

TO AGREE TO THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON CLAIMS ADVISING THAT PETITIONERS BE ALLOWED TO WITHDRAW THEIR PETITIONS ON BEHALF OF THE SURVIVING OFFICERS OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR SOLICITING AN EQUITABLE SETTLEMENT OF THE HALF PAY FOR LIFE PROMISED BY RESOLUIONS OF THE CONGRESS.
TO POSTPONE, TO NEXT MONDAY WEEK, CONSIDERATION OF THE RE- SOLUTION FROM THE HOUSE FIXING THE TIME OF ADJOURNMENT OF THIS SESSION OF CONGRESS.

TO AGREE TO AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC LANDS TO H. R. 175, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE ADJUSTMENT OF CLAIMS TO LANDS AND ESTABLISHING LAND OFFICES IN THE DISTRICT OF THE ISLAND OF NEW ORLEANS; SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT ALL CLAIMS DERIVED FROM TE SPANISH GOVERNMENT WHICH IN THE OPINION OF THE COMMISSIONERS ARE VALID UNDER THE LAWS OF SPAIN, AND ALL BRITISH GRANTS WHICH HAVE NOT BEEN REGRANTED BY THE SPANISH GOVERNMENT, SHALL BE RECOGNIZED AS VALID AGAINST THE CLAIMS OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE TREATY OF LIMITS WITH THE CREEK NATION OF INDIANS, MADE ON 1/22/1818.

TO AGREE TO AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC LANDS TO H. R. 175, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE ADJUSTMENT OF CLAIMS TO LAND AND ESTABLISHING LAND OFFICES IN THE DISTRICT OF THE ISLAND OF NEW ORLEANS, SAID AMENDMENT DECLARING THAT LANDS HELD BY VALID GRANT SHALL NEVER BE CLAIMED BY THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS THE BILL H. R. 175, PROVIDING FOR THE ADJUSTMENT OF CLAIMS TO LAND AND ESTABLISHING LAND OFFICES IN THE DISTRICT OF THE ISLAND OF NEW ORLEANS.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 52 (3 STAT. L. 416, APP. 4/4/1818), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE STATE OF TENNESSEE TO ISSUE GRANTS AND PERFECT TITLE TO CERTAIN EN- TRIES AND LOCATIONS OF LAND THEREIN DESCRIBED.

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 426, APP. 4/4/1818), TO REDUCE THE STAFF OF THE ARMY, SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT THE PRESIDENT APPOINT A COMMISSIONER TO PER- FORM AFTER 6/1/1819, THE DUTIES OF PURCHASING AND ISSUING ARMY RATIONS.
TO POSTPONE, TO THE 1ST MONDAY IN JULY, CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION RELA- TIVE TO INTERNAL IMPROVEMENTS.
TO POSTPONE, TO THE 1ST MONDAY IN MAY, CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL PRESCRIBING THE MODE OF SETTLING CONTROVERSIES BETWEEN TWO OR MORE STATES.
TO POSTPONE, TO 1ST MONDAY IN JULY, CONSIDERATION OF S. 25, A BILL TO INCREASE THE COMPENSATION OF CERTAIN FEDERAL JUDGES.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H. R. 64 (3 STAT. L. 432, APP. 4/18/1818), A BILL CLOSING THE PORTS OF THE UNITED STATES  AFTER SEPT. 30 NEXT, TO ALL VESSELS OWNED WHOLLY OR IN PART BY BRITISH SUBJECTS.
TO PASS H. R. 64 (3 STAT. L. 432, APP. 4/18/1818), A BILL CLOSING THE PORTS OF THE UNITED STATES AFTER SEPTEMBER 30 NEXT TO ALL VESSELS OWNED WHOLLY, OR IN PART, BY BRITISH SUBJECTS.

TO DISAGREE WITH AN AMENDMENT OF THE HOUSE TO THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 424, APP. 4/4/1818), PROVIDING FOR THE PAYMENT OF THE STATE OF INDIANA OF 3% OF THE NET PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS IN THAT STATE.
TO AMEND S. 25, A BILL INCREASING THE COMPENSATION OF CER- TAIN JUDGES OF THE U. S. COURTS; BY INSERTING THE SUM OF $5,000 AS THE YEARLY COMPENSATION OF THE CHIEF JUSTICE OF THE SUPREME COURT.

TO AMEND S. 25, A BILL PROVIDING FOR INCREASING THE COMPEN- SATION OF CERTAIN JUDGES OF THE FEDERAL COURTS; SAID AMEND- MENT PRESCRIBES THE SUM OF $3,600 AS THE YEARLY COMPENSATION OF THE JUDGE OF THE DISTRICT COURT IN LOUISIANA.
TO PASS S. 25, A BILL PROVIDING FOR INCREASING THE COMPENSA- TION OF CERTAIN FEDERAL JUDGES.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL (6 STAT. L. 211, APP. 4/20/1818), TO ALLOW JOHN HALL LATE A MAJOR IN THE MARINE CORPS, THE SUM OF 150 DOUBLOONS, STOLEN FROM HIM, TO SETTLE HIS ACCOUNT WITH THE NAVY DEPARTMENT.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 74 (3 STAT. L. 508, APP. 3/3/1819), A BILL SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE BILL TO IN- COROPRATE THE SUBSCRIBERS OF THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES, BY AUTHORIZING THE APPOINTMENT OF A VICE PRESIDENT AND DE- PUTY CASHIER T SIGN BILLS.
TO POSTPONE  TO JULY 4TH, CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 488, APP. 4/18/1818), TO ADMIT ILLINOIS TERRITORY TO THE UNION AS A STATE.

TO PASS S. 74 (3 STAT. L. 508, APP. 3/3/1819), A BILL SUP- PLEMENTARY TO THE ACT TO INCORPORATE THE SUBSCRIBERS OF THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES, BY AUTHORIZING THE APPOINTMENT OF A VICE PRESIDENT AND DEPUTY CASHIER TO SIGN BILLS.

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 441, APP. 4/20/1818), PROVI- DING FOR THE ERECTION OF ADDITIONAL BUILDINGS FOR THE ACCOM- DATION OF THE SEVERAL EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENTS; SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT SUCH BUILDINGS BE ERECTED, AS DIRECTED BY THE PRESIDENT, ON NY OF THE PUBLIC SQUARES OR OPEN SPACES EAST OR WEST OF 6TH STREET, EXCEPT IN THE CAPITOL SQUARE.
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 441, APP. 4/20/1818), PROVIDING FOR THE ERECTION OF ADDITIONAL BUILD- INGS FOR THE ACCOMADATIONS OF THE SEVERAL EXECUTIVE DEPART- MENTS.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE ARRANGEMENT WITH GREAT BRITAIN, RELATIVE TO THE NAVAL FORCE TO BE MAINTAINED ON THE LAKES.

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 458, APP. 4/20/1818), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE PUBLIC BUILDINGS AND FOR FURNISHING THE CAPITOL AND THE PRESIDENT'S HOUSE, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE APPROPRIATION OF $100,000 FOR PROCURING MATER- IALS, LAYING THE FUNDATION AND FOR OTHER PREPARATIONS FOR THE CENTRAL BUILDING OF THE CAPITOL.

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 458, APP. 4/20/1818), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FURNISHING THE CAPITOL AND THE PRESIDENTS HOUSE, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE APPROPRIATION OF $20,000 FOR FURNISHING THE PRESIDENT'S HOUSE.

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 460, APP. 4/20/1818), TO IN- CREASE THE DUTIES ON IRON IN BARS, BOLTS, AND IN PIGS, CAST- INGS, NAILS AND ALUM, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE DUTY OF ONE DOLLAR A HUNDRED WEIGHT ON IRON IN BARS AND BOLTS MANUFACTURED WITHOT ROLLING.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO COMPENSATE MESSENGERS AND SER- VANTS OF THE SENATE, SAID AMENDMENT TO ADD THE NAME OF CHARLES TIMS TO THOSE WHO ARE TO RECEIVE $100 EACH FOR EXTRA SERVICES.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT OF THE HOUSE TO THE BILL, TO IN- CREASE THE SALARIES OF CERTAIN OFFICERS OF THE GOVERNMENT, SAID AMENDMENT TO FIX THE SALARY OF THE CHIEF JUSTICE OF THE SUPREME COURT AT $5,000 A YEAR, AND THAT OF THE ASSOCIATE JUDGES AT $4,500 ACH.

TO AMEND TH E REPORT OF THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE REJECTING MATHEW TYON'S CLAIM FOR THE RETURN OF THE FINE PAID BY HIM IN 1798 FOR INFRACTION OF THE ALIEN AND SEDITION LAW: SAID AMENDMENT TO REMIT THE FINES PAID BY ALL PERSONS WHO WERE PROSECUTED AND FINEDUNDER THAT LAW.
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL (6 STAT. L. 216, APP. 12/28/1818), TO GRANT-GENERAL JOHN STARK A PENSION STARTING AUGUST 16, 1817.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY OF PEACE BETWEEN THE PAWNEE MARHAR TRIBE OF INDIANS AND THE UNITED STATES, MADE ON 6/22/1818.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY OF PEACE BETWEEN THE PITAVIRATE NOISY PAWNEE TRIBE OF INDIANS AND THE UNITED STATES, MADE ON 6/19/1818.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY OF PEACE MADE ON 6/20/1818, BETWEEN THE TRIBE OF INDIANS KNOWN AS THE PAWNEE REPUBLIC AND THE UNITED STATES.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY OF PEACE MADE ON JUNE 18, 1818, BETWEEN THE GRAND PAWNEE TRIBE OF INDIANS AND THE UNITED STATES.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY OF PEACE MADE ON SEPT. 20, 1818, BET- WEEN THE WYANDOT TRIBE OF INDIANS AND THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE TREATY OF PEACE MADE ON SEPT. 25, 1818, BETWEEN THE PEORIA, KANKASKIA, MITCHIGAMA CAHOLIA AND LAMAROIS TRIBES OF INDIANS AND THE UNITED STATES, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISO TO THE 5TH ARTICLE THEREOF: THAT THE LAN CEDED BY THIS ARTICLE NOT BE SOLD BUT TO THE UNITED STATES BY THE SAID TRIBE OF INDIANS.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY BETWEEN THE PEORIA, KANKASKIA, MITCHI- GAMIA, CAHOKIA, AND LAMOROIS TRIBES OF INDIANS AND THE U. S. MADE ON 9/25/1818.
TO RATIFY THE TREATY OF FRIENDSHIP, CESSION AND LIMITS MADE ON 8/24/1818, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHIEFS AND WARRIORS OF THE QUAPAW TRIBE OF INDIANS.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING TREATY MADE ON 9/29/1817, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE SACHEMS, CHIEFS, AND WAR- RIORS OF THE WYANDOT, SENECA, DELAWARE, SHAWNEE, POTAWATAMIE OTTAWAS, AND CHIPPEWAY TRIBES OF INDIANS, ALSO THE SUPPLE- MENTARY TREATY MAE ON SEPT
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING A TREATY MADE ON SEPT. 25, 1818, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHIEFS AND WARRIORS OF THE GREAT AND LITTLE OSAGE TRIBES OF INDIANS.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING A TREATY MADE ON OCT. 2, 1818, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE WEA TRIBE OF INDIANS.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING A TREATY MADE ON OCT. 2, 1818, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE POTAWATAMIE NATION OF INDIANS.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING A TREATY MADE ON OCT. 3, 1818, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE DELAWARE NATION OF INDIANS BY THEIR CHIEFS AND WARIORS.
TO POSTPONE THE NOMINATION OF WILLAIAM JONES AND OTHERS, AS DIRECTORS OF THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES, UNTIL THURSDAY, JANUARY 7TH NEXT.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON JUDICIARY WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO AMEND THE BILL FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED STATES COURTS, FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF CIRCUIT JUDGES; SAID AMENDMENT TO ABOLISH THE CIRCUIT COURTS AND TO TRANSFER THEIR JURIDICTION TO THE DISTRICT COURTS AND TO AUTHORIZE A DIRECT APPEAL TO THE SUPREME COURT, AND TO EN- LARGE THE RIGHT OF APPEAL BY REDUCING THE AMOUNT ON WHICH THE RIGHT MAY BE EXERCISES.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING 7TH TREATY OF FRIENDSHIP MADE ON OCT. 19, 1818, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHIEFS, HEADMEN AND WARRIORS OF THE CHICKASAW NATION OF INDIANS.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE TREATY MADE ON OCT. 6, 1818, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHIEFS AND WARRIORS OF THE MIAMI NATION OF INDIANS.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON JUDICIARY THE BILL FOR A MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE COURTS OF THE UNITED STATES, AND FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF CIRCUIT JUDGES, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO APPOINT TWO ADDITIONAL DISTRICT JUDGES IN KENTUCKY AND TENNESSEE.

TO RECOMMIT TO SELECT COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS, THE RE- SOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE ERECTION OF A MONUMENT OVER THE REMAINS OF GENERAL GEROGE WASHINGTON, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO PROVIDE FOR AN EQUESTRIAN STATUE IN CONFORMITY WITH THE RE- SOLUTION OF CONGRSS OF 1783.

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 489, APP. 3/2/1819), TO ENABLE THE PEOPLE OF THE ALABAMA TERRITORY TO FORM A CONSTITUTION AND STATE GOVERNMENT AND FOR THE ADMISSION OF SUCH STATE INTO THE UNION ON AN EQUAL FOOTING WITH THE ORIGINAL STATES; SAID AMENDMENT T FIX THE BOUNDARY OF THE PROPOSED STATE OF ALABAMA, BY STRIKING OUT AFTER THE WORD "THE" IN THE NINTH LINE, SECOND SECTION, AND INSERTING "COTTON GIN PORT ON THE TOMBIGBEE RIVER; THENCE DOWN THE SAME TO MOBILE BAY; THENCE THROUGH THE SAME BETWEEN MOBILE P...

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 489, APP. 3/12/1819), TO EN- ABLE THE PEOPLE OF THE TERRITORY OF ALABAMA TO FORM A CON- STITUTION AND STATE GOVERNMENT, AND FOR THE ADMISSION OF SUCH STATE INTO THE UNION ON AN EQUAL FOOTING WITH THE ORI- GINAL STATES; SAID MENDMENT TO STIPULATE A BOUNDARY OF THE TERRITORY OF ALABAMA ALONG THE LINE ESTABLISHED BY ACT OF THE ASSEMBLY OF THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY, BETWEEN THE COUNTIES OF WAYNE, GREEN AND JACKSON, ON ONE SIDE, AND WASH- INGTON, BALDWIN, AND MOBILE ON THE OTHER....

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 509, APP. 3/3/1819), TO SUS- PEND FOR A LIMITED TIME THE SALE ON FORFEITURE OF LANDS FOR FAILURE TO COMPLETE THE PAYMENT THEREON; SAID AMENDMENT TO CHARGE INTEREST ON INSTALLMENTS FROM THE DATE THEY WERE DUE UNTIL THE DATE O EXTENSION, (MARCH 31, 1820), IF PAID WITH- IN THAT TIME; BUT IF INSTALLMENT PAYMENTS ARE NOT MADE BY THAT DATE, INTEREST TO BE CHARGED FROM DATE OF PURCHASE.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE JOINT RESOLU- TION PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION REGARDING THE CHOOSING OF ELECTORS OF PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT AND OF REPRESENTATIVES IN CONGRESS.

TO RECOMMIT THE BILL FOR THE ORGANIZATION OF THE COURTS OF THE U. S. AND THE APPOINTMENT OF CIRCUIT JUDGES TO THE COM- MITTEE ON JUDICIARY, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT SAME BACK WITH PROVISIONS FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF ONE OR MORE ADDITION- AL JUSTICES OF HE SUPREME COURT, AND FOR ALTERING THE PRE- SENT DIVISIONS OF THE UNITED STATES INTO CIRCUITS, THUS PRO- VIDING FOR THE MORE SPEEDY ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE IN THE STATES OF TENNESSEE, KENTUCKY, LOUISIANA, INDIANA, MISSISSIPPI AND ILLINOIS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE COURTS OF THE UNITED STATES AND THE APPOINTMENT OF CIRCUIT JUDGES.

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE THE JOINT RESOLUTION FOR AMENDMENT OF THE CONSTITUTION BY ALTERING THE MODE OF CHOOS- ING ELECTORS OF PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT, AND OF REPRE- SENTATIVES IN CONGRESS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO MODIFY SAID RESOLUTION SO THAT TE CHOICE OF PRESIDENT SHALL BE MADE BY A PLURALITY OF VOTES AND NOT BY STATES.
TO PASS THE BILL FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE COURTS OF THE UNITED STATES AND FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF CIR- CUIT JUDGES.

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 480, APP. 2/15/1819), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE MILITARY SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES FOR 1819, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE APPROPRIATION OF $10,000 FOR EXTRA PAY TO NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICERS AND SOLD- IERS, EMPLOYEDIN THE CONSTRUCTION AND REPARIRS OF MILITARY ROADS.

TO AMEND THE PETITION PROVIDING FOR THE CLAIM OF JACOB PURKHILL; SAID AMENDMENT TO INSTRUCT THE COMMITTEE ON CLAIMS TO BRING IN A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE PAYMENT OF SLAVES LOST TO THEIR OWNERS, BY BEING IMPRESSED INTO THE MILITARY SERVICE OF THE UNITED STTES.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE CLAIM OF JACOB PURKHILL, SAID AMENDMENT TO INSTRUCT THE COMMITTEE ON CLAIMS TO BRING IN A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF PETITIONER.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE CONVENTION MADE IN LONDON OCT. 20, 1818, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND GREAT GRITAIN AND IRELAND.
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF COMMITTEE ON FINANCE DENYING THE PET- ITION OF NATHANIEL GODDARD, AND OTHERS, FORMERLY OWNERS OF THE SHIP ARIADNE, AND HER CARGO.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE BILL PRESCRIBING THE MODE OF COMMENCING, PROSECUTION, AND DECIDING CONTROVERSIES BETWEEN TWO OR MORE STATES.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH NEXT, THE BILL PRESCRIBING THE MODE OF COMMENCING, PROSECUTING, AND DECIDING CONTROVERSIES BETWEEN TWO OR MORE STATES.
TO PASS THE JOINT RESOLUTION PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION PROVIDING FOR A UNIFORM MODE OF ELECTING ELEC- TORS OF PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT, AND REPRESENTATIVES IN CONGRESS.

TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5, 1819, THE BILL EXTENDING FOR FIVE YEARS THE PENSIONS HERETOFORE GRANTED TO THE WIDOWS AND OR- PHANS OF THE OFFICERS AND SOLDIERS WHO DIED, OR WERE KILLED, IN THE LATE WAR WITH GREAT BRITAIN.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH NEXT, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE ERECTION OF AN EQUESTRIAN STATUE OF GENERAL WASHINGTON IN CAPITOL SQUARE.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE EREC- TION OF AN EQUESTRIAN STATUE OF GENERAL WASHINGTON IN THE CAPITOL SQUARE.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE ERECTION OF AN EQUESTRIAN STATUE OF GENERAL GEORGE WASHINGTION IN CAPITOL SQUARE, IF THE COST IS TO EXCEED $150,000, THE PRESIDENT IS REQUESTED TO REPORT THE COST TO THE NEXT SESSION OFCONGRESS.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH NEXT, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE ERECTION OF AN EQUESTRIAN STATUE OF GENERAL WAHSINGTON IN THE CAPITOL SQUARE.
TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF WALTER BOWNE TO BE A DIRECTOR OF THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 484, APP. 2/20/1819), INCREASING THE SALARIES OF CERTAIN OFFICERS OF THE GOVERNMENT, WITH IN- STRUCTIONS TO PROVIDE FOR AN INCREASE IN THE SALARIES OF THE DISTRICT JUDGES.

TO AGREE TO AMENDMENT OF COMMITTEE ON JUDICIARY TO BILL (3 STAT. L. 484, APP. 2/20/1819), INCREASING THE SALARIES OF CERTAIN OFFICERS OF THE GOVERNMENT, SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT THE SALARIES OF CHIEF JUSTICE OF THE U. S. BE $5,000; AND OF THE JUDGESOF THE U

TO POSTPONE TO MARCH 5TH, NEXT, THE RESOLUTION ADDING A NEW MEMBER TO THE COMMITTEE ALREADY APPOINTED ON THE SUBJECT OF THE SEMINOLE WAR IN THE PLACE OF THE HONORABLE MR. FORSYTH, RECENTLY APPOINTED TO A FOREIGN MISSION.
TO AMEND THE BILL MAKING FURTHER PROVISION RESPECTING THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS, SAID AMENDMENT TO RESTRICTING SUCH SALES OF PUBLIC ROADS AFTER A GIVEN DATE, TO CASH ONLY IN CERTAIN LAND OFFICES.

TO AMEND TH PUBLIC LAND BILL BY ELIMINATING FROM THE 3RD SECTION THE PROVISION WHICH PRESCRIBES THE PRICE PER ACRE AT $1.50, PAYABLE AT THE TIME OF MAKING SUCH ENTRY, AND SUB- STITUTING A NEW SCALE OF PRICES.

TO AMEND THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY PROVIDING THAT ANY PERSON ACTUALLY SETTLED ON ANY QUARTER SECTION OF LAND PREVIOUSLY OFFERED AT PUBLIC SALE AND REMAINING UNSOLD, SHALL BE EN- TITLED TO RECEIVE A LICENSE TO REMAIN ON SAID LAND FOR FIVE YEARS, AND DURING HIS PERIOD SHALL HAVE THE PRIOR RIGHT TO PURCHASE SAID LAND BY PAYING FOR IT, PLUSE INTEREST FROM DATE OF HIS LICENSE.
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY FORBIDDING THE SALE OF MORE THAN ONE SECTION OF LAND TO ONE PERSON IN ANY ONE YEAR.
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY FIXING THE MINIMUM PRICE AT WHICH PUBLIC LAND SHALL BE OFFERED AT PUBLIC SALE AT $1.00 PER ACRE INSTEAD OF $1.50.
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY REDUCING THE PRICE AT WHICH PUBLIC LAND SHALL BE OFFERED AT PUBLIC SALE FROM $1.50 TO $1.25 PER ACRE.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH NEXT THE PUBLIC LAND BILL.
TO FILL THE BLANKS IN THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY PUTTING THE ACT INTO OPERATION ON 10/1/1820.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE BILL RESPECTING THE TRANSPORTA- TION OF PERSONS OF COLOR FOR SALE, OR TO BE HELD TO LABOR.

TO AMEND THE APPROPRIATION BILL FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR 1819, SAID AMENDMENT TO APPROPRIATE THE SUM OF $535,000 FOR CONSTRUCTING AND COMPLETING THE UNITED STATES ROADS FROM CUMBERLAND TO THE OHIO RIVER.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE TREATY OF AMITY, SETTLE- MENT AND LIMITS MADE ON FEB. 22, 1819, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA AND SPAIN, WITH REFERENCE TO THE FLORIDAS.
TO ORDER PRINTING OF A REPORT FROM THE APPOINTED COMMITTEE INQUIRING INTO ACTIVITIES CONCERNING THE SEMINOLE WAR IN WEST FLORIDA.

TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 493, APP. 3/2/1819), AUTHORIZING THE PEOPLE OF MISSOURI TO FORM A CONSTITUTION PRELIMINARY TO THE ADMISSION OF THE TERRITORY INTO THE UNION AS A STATE.

TO AMEND A BILL (3 STAT. L. 493, APP. 3-2-1819), AUTHORIZING THE PEOPLE OF MO. TO FORM A CONSTITUTION; SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE CLAUSE PROVIDING THAT ALL CHILDREN OF SLAVES, BORN WITHIN THE SAID STATE AFTER THE ADMISSION THEREOF INTO THE UNION SHAL BE FREE, BUT MAY BE HELD TO SERVICE UNTIL 25 YEARS OF AGE.

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 493, APP. 3/2/1819), AUTHOR- IZING THE PEOPLE OF MISSOURI TO FORM A CONSTITUTION; SAID AMENDMENT ELIMINATES THE PROVISO THAT PROHIBITS THE FURTHER INTRODUCTION OF SLAVERY OR INVOLUNTARY SERVITUDE, EXCEPT FOR THE PUNISHMENT O CRIME WHEREOF THE PARTY SHALL HAVE BEEN DULY CONVICTED.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL REVIVING THE POWERS OF THE COMMISSIONERS FOR ASCERTAINING AND DECI- DING ON CLAIMS TO LAND IN THE DISTRICT OF DETROIT, AND FOR SETTLING THE CLAIMS TO LAND AT GREEN BAY AND PRAIRIE DU CHIEN IN THE TERRITOY OF MICHIGAN.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON TERRITORIES THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 493, APP. 3/2/1819), AUTHORIZING THE PEOPLE OF THE SOUTHERN PART OF MISSOURI TO FORM A SEPARATE TERRITORIAL GOVERNMENT WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO AMEND SAID BILL SO THAT THE FURTHER INTRODUCTION F SLAVERY, OR INVOLUNTARY SERVITUDE WITHIN THE SAID TERRITORY EXCEPT FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF CRIMES, BE PROHIBITED.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE CONVENTION MADE ON FEB. 27, 1819, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHIEFS AND HEAD- MEN OF THE CHEROKEE NATION OF INDIANS.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL TOMORROW THE BILL FIXING THE TIME FOR THE NEXT MEETING OF CONGRESS.
